result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • David L. Meinders was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Absolute sobriety.

DNA sample.  

Any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicles T&R in defendants name, as is defendant himself. IID to be installed within 14 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:15am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears by phone from Dodge Correctional Facility/pro se.
(Motion to Bifurcated Sentence)

COURT notes review of Motion to Modify Bifurcated Sentence, and the two physicians reports
State does not object to modification.

COURT makes findings - Defendant meets criteria and has given proof as required.
COURT grants petition for Modification as requested and signs order; DOC to carry out order as soon as possible.

Adj: 11:18am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case 16CF26 called: 2:27pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (OWI 7th/Repeater)>> AMEND to DELETE Repeater allegation
Ct. 2 (PAC 7th/Repeater)>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 7th)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
Argument by both counsel on confinement and ES length.

COURT ORDERS: 7 Years TOTAL: 3  Years incarceration and 4 Years ES, with credit for 95 days of time already served; CC.

CONDITIONS of ES: 3 years DL Rev w/credit, concurrent with refusal revocation order; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 3 years, concurrent with refusal IID order; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies; Defendant may not drive unless obtains valid DL; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Any CC not paid during incarceration to be paid as condition of ES; AODA (only one needed between this case and refusal order); Absolute sobriety; DNA sample and surcharge.

>>Defendant is eligible for SAP; Defendant NOT eligible for CIP.
>>Defendant remanded to MCSD for delivery to WI State Prison System.

Adj: 2:56pm
Exhibit #1 Located in COC Exhibit Storage

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:03pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn.

COURT questions Atty Bohn re: refusal - Attorney Bohn states issue is probable cause.

Deputy Dan D'Acquisto (MCSD) sworn and testifies.
COURT recesses to re-watch video (Exhibit 1) and for State to procure copy of statute; BOTR: 2:46pm - State files copy of Trans code/statute with COURT.
Argument by State - Request COURT find refusal was unreasonable and enter judgment on refusal; Argument by Attorney Bohn - requests COURT find refusal reasonable.

COURT makes findings - COURT deems refusal of defendant was unlawful.
COURT ORDERS: AODA; 3 years DL Rev w/credit;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 3 years; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies.

COURT notes this trial set for 4/20/16 under Speedy trial demand requested.
Bond continues.

Adj: 3:16pm

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:25am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

State notes deputy is not present today - State requests to reschedule this hearing before JT which is set for 4/20; COURT questions parties how long hearing will take - State notes matter will likely take about 20 minutes; Atty Bohn notes probable cause is at issue.

COURT resets matter to 2:00pm today.

Adj: 8:27am
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to L.E. 2/18/16)
and Certificate of Appearance (suboena mailed to T.D. 2/18/16)

Refusal hearing at 04-12-2016 08:15 am.
Jury Trial at 04-20-2016 09:00 am.
